job_title: data analyst and market research specialist
job_description: we are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented data analyst and market research specialist to join our team. the successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing market data, identifying trends, and providing insights to support strategic business decisions. this role is crucial in understanding market conditions, customer preferences, and competitive positioning to help the company maintain a strong market presence and make informed decisions.key responsibilities:data collection and analysis:collect, process, and analyze large datasets using statistical tools and techniques.conduct data profiling and validation to ensure data accuracy and quality.develop and maintain databases to track customer insights, market trends, and performance metrics.market research:conduct comprehensive market research to identify industry trends, target audiences, and market opportunities.analyze the competitive landscape and provide recommendations for strategic initiatives.prepare detailed reports and presentations to communicate research findings effectively.insights and reporting:provide actionable insights by interpreting complex data sets and transforming them into understandable and impactful information.design and develop dashboards and reports to support decision-making processes.identify opportunities for market expansion and new business initiatives.customer and competitor analysis:profile customer segments and behavior to support marketing and sales strategies.monitor and evaluate competitor activities to understand their impact on the market and identify whitesky’s competitive advantages.collaboration and communication:work closely with the marketing, sales, and strategy teams to align research findings with business goals.collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive strategic projects and initiatives.qualifications:education: bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, marketing, business, or a related field. master’s degree is a plus.experience:minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and market research.technical skills:proficiency in data analysis tools, software and market research methodologies.analytical skills:strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide strategic insights.communication skills:excellent written and verbal communication skills for presenting findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.attention to detail:high level of accuracy and attention to detail in handling and analyzing data.preferred skills:knowledge of the aviation industry or experience in market research for transportation sectors.familiarity with crm platforms and data management tools.ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

about fliprafi, luqman, and anjar, who were college friends in universitas indonesia, started flip as a project in 2015 to transfer payments to each other at a fraction of what banks would charge them. they are pioneers in the indonesian market, with their technology now helping millions of indonesians, both individuals and businesses, carry out bank-to-bank money transfers through a reliable and seamless app.after seven years of operations, flip has helped indonesians transfer money worth several trillions of rupiah and has received double-digit funding from respectable investors such as sequoia india, insight partner, and insignia. flip’s ultimate mission is to give indonesians access to one of the most progressive and fairest financial services in the world.at flip, we always strive to provide the fairest place for you to work, learn, and grow with talented and fun people in various opportunities to advance your career and get fair rewards. we believe that we have to treat employees, customers, and all stakeholders fairly and respectfully. fair treatment for employees means we establish clear goals, facilitate our employees to achieve them, and value their contribution to the company with equitable benefits.about the roleas the fraud analytics lead, you will have the unique opportunity to shape the company’s fraud prevention strategy and build solutions that protect our customers and business. this role offers high visibility with senior leadership, and your insights will drive impactful decisions across our consumer and business platforms. you’ll work with a talented team and innovative tools to stay ahead of any fraud threats, ensuring our platform remains secure and trusted.what you’ll dodevelop and implement fraud detection models;monitor real-time and historical data to identify patterns and anomalies that indicate fraud;collaborate with product and engineering teams to develop and refine fraud rules and ensure effective implementation;lead fraud investigations and coordinate with fraud operations, legal, and compliance teams to investigate flagged cases and conduct thorough root cause analysis;work closely with engineering teams to build dashboards for tracking fraud metrics and ensuring continuous monitoring;partner with product, engineering, and compliance teams to align fraud detection strategies with business goals;create weekly and monthly reports for upper management with actionable insights and recommendations;stay up-to-date with fraud trends and industry best practices to recommend innovative fraud prevention strategies;lead and develop a team of fraud analysts to ensure continuous learning and professional growth.what you’ll needbachelor’s degree in data science, finance, business, statistics, or a related field. a master’s degree is a plus;5+ years of experience in fraud analytics, financial services, payments, or fintech industries;experience working with consumer and b2b financial transactions is highly preferred;excellent communication skills to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders;strong knowledge of data analytics tools (e.g., sql, python, r) and visualization platforms (e.g., tableau, power bi);familiarity with fraud monitoring tools and real-time alerting systems;understanding of transaction flows and payment gateways is a plus;strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail;strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate across departments.

job_title: risk analytics and underwriting - financial services
job_description: lentera inspirasi pembiayaan (lip), an entity of flip, is building the fairest and most customer centric multi-finance platform in indonesia.we are seeking an experienced risk analytics and underwriting senior manager to lead and manage the risk underwriting process, develop and enhance scorecards, optimize the use of external data, and implement fraud triggers for our multi-finance operations. the ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of credit risk, fraud management, and risk analytics, capable of developing robust risk models that drive decision-making and mitigate potential risks.about fliprafi, luqman, and anjar, who were college friends in universitas indonesia, started flip as a project in 2015 to transfer payments to each other at a fraction of what banks would charge them. they are pioneers in the indonesian market, with their technology now helping millions of indonesians, both individuals and businesses, carry out bank-to-bank money transfers through a reliable and seamless app.after seven years of operations, flip has helped indonesians transfer money worth several trillions of rupiah and has received double-digit funding from respectable investors such as sequoia india, insight partner, and insignia. flip’s ultimate mission is to give indonesians access to one of the most progressive and fairest financial services in the world.at flip, we always strive to provide the fairest place for you to work, learn, and grow with talented and fun people in various opportunities to advance your career and employees to achieve them, and value their contribution to the company with equitable benefits.what you'll dolead and oversee the underwriting process, ensuring the quality and integrity of risk assessments and approvals.develop, implement, and continuously improve risk scorecards for credit decisioning, working closely with data scientists and risk analysts.manage and optimize the use of external data sources (e.g., credit bureaus, alternative data) to enhance risk assessment and underwriting accuracy.design and monitor fraud triggers and detection systems to minimize fraud-related risks across all channels.collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., it, product, legal) to ensure alignment of risk policies with business goals.analyze portfolio performance and risk metrics, generating insights to drive proactive risk management strategies.mentor and lead a team of risk professionals, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and excellence.ensure compliance with all and managing risk scorecards, fraud detection systems, and underwriting frameworks.in-depth knowledge of external data sources (credit bureaus, alternative data) and their application in risk assessment.proficient in data analysis tools (e.g., sql, python, r) and experience with risk modeling techniques.excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.familiarity with regulatory requirements and best practices in risk management and fraud prevention.

candidate will have strong expertise in fraud risk management, rule development, and strategic planning within the financial sector.about fliprafi, luqman, and anjar, who were college friends in dodevelop and manage fraud risk strategies, including the creation of rules and triggers to detect and prevent fraudulent activity across all business operations.build and continuously refine fraud problem-solving skills with the ability to anticipate fraud risks and take preventive actions.strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex risk strategies to senior management and stakeholders.leadership experience in managing fraud teams and driving strategic fraud initiatives.
